item.title: Two common types of sleep apnea medical malpractice
item.description: When many people think of sleep apnea, the first thing that comes to mind may be snoring, or perhaps the inconvenience of a CPAP machine. Beyond these concerns, though, the most common type of sleep apnea, called obstructive sleep apnea, is a serious and potentially life-threatening medical condition. Obstructive sleep apnea is a medical condition where the muscles of the throat and soft palate intermittently relax during sleep. When this happens, those anatomical structures drop and partially or fully obstruct the airway.
